ud6.7:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud6.7:1.3: Now at that time Venerable Subhūti was sitting not far from the Buddha, cross-legged, with his body straight, having attained the immersion free of placing the mind.
ud6.7:2.1: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ud6.7:3.1: Then, understanding this matter, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud6.7:4.1: “In whom mental vibrations are cleared away,
ud6.7:4.4: having overcome the four yokes, <j>they never return.”
